intro: Tetraria mlanjensis, commonly known as the Malanje tetraria, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Malanje Province of Angola. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a short stem, narrow leaves, and small white to yellowish flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
